title: So I need some help picking up a top laner
body:
So, I normally just play mid and I keep climbing, almost got to plat last season with just Ahri. I however, keep loosing since I cant get my role. I use to be a mid/support main, but I cant support all the time in Dynamic Q. I was thinking of picking up top lane to a decent level, maybe practice the basics of top lane and understand how the lane works. I need help picking up a strong champion this season on the top lane that I can use to hold my own and possibly carry with this season. 

Any suggestions? I was thinking Fiora, but...she seems really hard.

replies.body: You could try a ranged top laner like Lissandra or Vlad. It seems like a good way to transition from mid to top.
Agreeing with this.  When I first transitioned to toplane, I found melee laners to be much less forgiving than ranged ones.  So Quinn, Teemo, Lulu were the first couple I could become proficient in.

Fiora is not as hard as you might think. She would've been if you had to build squishy and well-timed riposte was your only way to survive a fight, but with juggernaut items and her base stats it's just not the case. I would recommend fiora and lulu as they are simply the strongest top laners at the moment.

{{champion:106}} {{champion:48}} {{champion:14}} {{champion:36}} {{champion:54}} {{champion:31}}  are very strong, relatively easy to pick up, and have a pretty decent time surviving in lane due to healing/shields, get super tanky naturally and can still put out a lot of damage.

I think Volibear is one of the most underrated solo-q champions; the guy(bear) builds full tank and still chunks people for massive amounts of damage with his W.
you could play teemo c:

I like Kennen and Gnar personally.  Ranged, good base damages and high CC which allow you to build more durable without sacrificing a lot of usefulness (although I usually build Kennen full AP).  They provide strong initiation which is always a good trait for a top laner to have.  Gnar is a little tougher because of managing his rage bar but in general, neither of them have awfully difficult mechanics.

Pick up some tanky dude. They are probably the strongest class for top lane, they are usually simple, safety, and they can teach you the basic of top lane. {{champion:111}} {{champion:78}} {{champion:54}} {{champion:98}} {{champion:223}} . They are the best atm.

If you need to counter tanks {{champion:122}} {{champion:48}} {{champion:114}}.

Other honorable champs {{champion:41}} {{champion:133}} {{champion:104}}. You can pick marksmans but if you want to learn the basics of the lane don't do it. They don't rly belong to the top lane and hopefully riot will act soon.

Play {{champion:84}} {{champion:105}} {{item:3748}} {{item:3742}} {{item:3053}} {{item:3025}} if you just want to be a bastard and play something off-meta.

{{champion:122}}  is expensive but he is a blast. He takes a bit of practice but is so satisfying to play.

{{champion:23}} is good as he teaches you the importance of objective control and map pressure since he rarely contributes in team fights.

{{champion:114}} {{champion:92}} are somewhat squishy and dependent on outplaying their opponent rather than just farming so I would avoid them if you are new to top lane.

{{champion:78}} {{champion:54}} {{champion:111}} {{champion:57}} all great choices if you're looking for a tank

{{champion:75}} My favorite toplaner. As much as I love him I advise you stay away from him if you are learning him in high gold. At that elo players know how to punish his glaring weaknessess and even good Nasus players struggle, someone who is new to Nasus AND toplane will get destroyed every game and learn nothing. EDIT:
{{champion:78}} is also really good.
Cho'Gath is pretty noob-friendly, as evidenced by the fact that I do ok with him. {{champion:75}} is also pretty easy so long as you can focus on farming for the first 15-ish minutes.

Right now, top is basically high dmg champs that are going tank ({{champion:114}} {{champion:84}} ), unstoppable walls of defense ({{champion:111}} {{champion:54}} {{champion:122}} ), and of course {{champion:80}} . The AP champs of top took a good hit this season so I'd avoid those but that is my personal opinion there.

> Any suggestions? I was thinking Fiora, but...she seems really hard.

Take vlad, max Q, Get wota, cdr boots, a visage, with a rylis if you are taking a ton of damage Q farm. However, if you are able to stay fully healed use Q to harass the enemy. 1/2 the time it works to the point where you can get a level or two advantage.  The other half of the time, you just need to use Q to sustain and not have to go b, until the enemy runs out of mana. 

I personally prefer scaling hp yellows and per level ap for all of my other runes.  I also take tank masteries with the mastery that gives 300 hp (It also gives alot of hp late game on cannons and ect... that die near you). You should get pretty tanky, and still have quite a bit of damage. To finish off my build I normally take a combination of zhonyas, dcap, ludens, void staff or liandris torment, and any other ap/hp item. 

Just a warning, warmogs is sort of a newb trap, I'd also suggest keeping e maxed at your 4 stacks after level 5 or so. The build puts you near 3-4k hp, and 600-800ish ap if you finish it out with a Dcap. BTW if you do take all scaling per level you will have a "fun" early game, but your late game is pretty amazing.

Pantheon's pretty nice in top lane. He can even play mid (or could at least). He's got good harass with his Q and these new melee items have helped him out a lot. He can carry hard thanks to his mobility as long as you close the game before 30-35 minutes.

And finally he's got major swag points.{{champion:80}}
Renekton, Maokai, and Irelia are generally flexible and reliable options.
ALSO! Forgot to say, I'm a gnar, karma, galio main, so if you want to try any of those top feel free to ask!

If you want to transition from mid to top, try going yasuo, zed, galio, malphite, or just tanks. Those are generally easier to play in top, first off, because the first 4 can mid lane as well as top lane, and tanks, because they are usually mechanically simple, protect your ADC, and kill the enemy adc.
